body: Does this happen to 1.57.0 or earlier versions as well?
@alto-ruby No it does not seem to happen in 1.57. Sorry, forgot to put that in the initial report; will add it.

rename.to: [Ruby] [1.58.0 regression] Segfault in channel constructor on Windows

body:
Thanks for the very detailed information, I am able to reproduce it however I got very confusion results
1. the `require "google/protobuf"` line didn't matter in my tests
2. bisect pointed me to a [commit](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/commit/07b591d4e3b729e19c272bbe8c6812c7f08f7eb4) which has no behavior change at all
3. I built created `dbg` builds and gdb pointed me to the access to [static thread_local ExecCtx* exec_ctx_;](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.58.0/src/core/lib/iomgr/exec_ctx.h#L189)
4. it turned out that `dbg` build segfaluts since 1.49.1, the first version that supports `mingw-ucrt`. 

I'm out of clues now.

--

gdb before crash
```
Thread 1 hit Breakpoint 1, grpc_core::ExecCtx::ExecCtx (this=0x119d7ff2a0) at ./src/core/lib/iomgr/exec_ctx.h:101

Continuing.

   from /cygdrive/c/Users/hannahshisfb/.local/share/gem/ruby/3.1.0/gems/grpc-1.58.0-x64-mingw-ucrt/src/ruby/lib/grpc/grpc_c.so
#5  0x00000000710463df in ?? ()
   from /cygdrive/c/Users/hannahshisfb/.local/share/gem/ruby/3.1.0/gems/grpc-1.58.0-x64-mingw-ucrt/src/ruby/lib/grpc/grpc_c.so
#6  0x00007ffada94262d in x64-ucrt-ruby310!rb_class_new_instance_pass_kw ()
   from /cygdrive/c/Ruby31-x64/bin/x64-ucrt-ruby310.dll
#7  0x00007ffadaa63547 in x64-ucrt-ruby310!rb_error_arity ()
   from /cygdrive/c/Ruby31-x64/bin/x64-ucrt-ruby310.dll
#8  0x00007ffadaa7fe82 in x64-ucrt-ruby310!rb_vm_call_with_refinements ()

   from /cygdrive/c/Windows/System32/KERNEL32.DLL
#16 0x00007ffb00d7ec0b in ntdll!RtlUserThreadStart ()
   from /cygdrive/c/Windows/SYSTEM32/ntdll.dll
#17 0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()
Backtrace stopped: previous frame inner to this frame (corrupt stack?)
(gdb) up
#1  grpc_core::ExecCtx::ExecCtx (this=0x119d7ff2a0)
    at ./src/core/lib/iomgr/exec_ctx.h:101
101       ExecCtx() : flags_(GRPC_EXEC_CTX_FLAG_IS_FINISHED) {
(gdb) p *this
$3 = {_vptr.ExecCtx = 0xfd79f0 <vtable for grpc_core::ExecCtx+16>,
  closure_list_ = {head = 0x0, tail = 0x0}, combiner_data_ = {
    active_combiner = 0x0, last_combiner = 0x0}, flags_ = 1,
  starting_cpu_ = 4294967295,
  time_cache_ = {<grpc_core::Timestamp::ScopedSource> = {<grpc_core::Timestamp::Source> = {
        _vptr.Source = 0xfd4ab0 <vtable for grpc_core::ScopedTimeCache+16>},
      previous_ = 0x1066450 <grpc_core::NoDestructSingleton<grpc_core::(anonymous namespace)::GprNowTimeSource>::value_>},
    cached_time_ = {<absl::lts_20230802::optional_internal::optional_data<grpc_core::Timestamp, true>> = {<absl::lts_20230802::optional_internal::optional_data_b
ase<grpc_core::Timestamp>> = {<absl::lts_20230802::optional_internal::optional_data_dtor_base<grpc_core::Timestamp, true>> = {engaged_ = false, {data_ = {
                millis_ = 0,

ptional_internal::copy_traits)0>> = {<No data fields>}, <absl::lts_20230802::optional_internal::optional_assign_base<(absl::lts_20230802::optional_internal::copy
_traits)0>> = {<No data fields>}, <No data fields>}},
  static exec_ctx_ = <error reading variable: Missing COFF symbol "_ZN9grpc_core7ExecCtx9exec_ctx_E".>, last_exec_ctx_ = 0x10}

(gdb)

issue.title: chore(spanner): Rename read_session variable to session

labels.name: api: spanner
labels.description: Issues related to the Spanner API.

issue.body:
Small PR to rename a local variable from `read_session` (a relic of pre-ILB) to `session`.

With the changes in ILB, the `Pool` class doesn't distinguish between read sessions and write sessions anymore. Everything is taken from the same stack, so they are just "sessions".

issue.title: [Ruby] do not use static thread local member in scoped activity

labels.name: release notes: no
labels.description: Indicates if PR should not be in release notes

repository.name: grpc
repository.description: C++ based gRPC (C++, Python, Ruby, Objective-C, PHP, C#)

issue.body:
This is to fix #34297
PR #34103 removed the use of `static threada_local` as class member (not supported on windows) in ExecCtx, now it crashes at a later time in ScopedActivity accessing another static thread_local class memeber.
This PR made a similar change by moving it into a function, with this PR, script in the original issue stopped crashing.
```
$ ruby test.rb
Never gets here
```

There are still static threada_local class member usages in the following classes:
[Context](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.59.0/src/core/lib/promise/context.h#L48)
[ScopedSource](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.59.0/src/core/lib/gprpp/time.h#L175)
[PerCpuShardingHelper](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.59.0/src/core/lib/gprpp/per_cpu.h#L79)
[WorkSerializer::DispatchingWorkSerializer](https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/v1.59.0/src/core/lib/gprpp/work_serializer.cc#L387), DEBUG only

I'll run more tests to see if they cause crashes as well.



--
New crashes with the ExecCtx fix (#34103 ):
```
(gdb) s
grpc_core::Activity::ScopedActivity::ScopedActivity (activity=0x1c01d0c7280,
    this=<synthetic pointer>) at ./src/core/lib/promise/activity.h:241
241       static thread_local Activity* g_current_activity_;
(gdb) s
0xffffffff93d10000 in ?? ()
(gdb) bt
#0  0xffffffff93d10000 in ?? ()
Backtrace stopped: previous frame identical to this frame (corrupt stack?)
```
crash log:
```

 [0x00007ff6d3671e22]

issue.title: test: Fix grpc segfault in tests for vision and asset

repository.name: google-cloud-ruby
repository.description: Google Cloud Client Library for Ruby

issue.body:
The segfault is due to https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/34297 and seems to happen when protobuf is required before grpc. The `helper.rb` files for tests have all been updated to prevent this, but we have a few tests that aren't using `helper.rb`. This PR updates those tests.

Fixes #23381
Fixes #23382
Fixes #23383
Fixes #23384
